name: ping
description: returns pong!

name: echo
description: returns <arg>

name: newrole
description: creates role <arg>

name: deleterole
description: deletes role <arg>

name: iam
description: adds you to role <arg>

name: iamn
description: removes you from role <arg>

name: whois
description: returns everyone who has role <arg>

name: roles
description: will display all the self-assignable roles that exist

name: Roles
description: will display all the Mod/Exec/XP Assigned roles that exist

name: purgeroles
description: deletes all empty self-assignable roles

name: help
man
description: an interface to the reference manuals
help can be used with no argument in order to list each command and provide a brief overview of each command
In order to bring up specific examples of how to use each command, use ".man <command>"

name: poll
description: Commands to create a  poll in a channel.
Doing `.poll <arg>` starts a yes/no poll where <arg> is the question
A poll can also be created with multiple options. When choosing multiple options, you can specify up to 12 arguments

name: urban
description: returns definition from urban dictionary of <arg>

name: wolfram
description: returns the result of passing <arg> to Wolfram Alpha

name: remindmein
description: create a reminder

name: showreminders
description: Show all your active reminders and their corresponding messageIDs

name: deletereminder
description: deletes a reminder that has a messageId of <arg>
the "messageId" can be obtained by using the ".showreminders" command

name: load
description: loads the commands in the class <arg>.
The classes and their corresponding commands can be determined using the ".help" command.

name: unload
description: unloads the commands in the class <arg>.
The classes and their corresponding commands can be determined using the ".help" command.

name: reload
description: reloads the commands in the class <arg>.
The classes and their corresponding commands can be determined using the ".help" command.

name: exc
description: executes the command <arg> on the bot server.
The classes and their corresponding commands can be determined using the ".help" command.

name: embed
em
description: Allows Minions to post embed messages.
For odd number of arguments the first arg will be used as description in the embed and the rest as field title and content.
For even number there will be no description.

name: modspeak
warn
description: Posts the warning message <arg> in embed format. No quotes required with message.

name: propagatemute
propm
description: Spreads permissions for the @Muted role throughout all channels in the gulid

name: slowmode
description: Puts the current channel into slowmode.
Default delay between messages is 10 seconds.
Optionally you can specify the delay with an integer value of seconds.
Mods are immune to slowmode and anyone with one of the following perms: Manage Channel, Manage Messages, Administrator Permission, or you are the Server Owner

name: makechannel
description: Creates a channel with the given `<name>`.
If you want to create a secret channel enter a "1" after the name
Council is notified of the new channel

name: clear
description: Clears the last *X* messages from the current channel.
10 messages by default, or optionally you can specify the number of messages between 1 and 100 inclusively.
Messages older than 2 weeks will not be deleted

name: purge
example: .purge <@ mention of target user> [<number of messages>]
description: Purges the last *X* messages from target user from current channel.
Defaults to 10 messages, or optionally you can specify the number of messages to delete wiht a max of 100.

name: mute
description: Adds the @MUTED role to target user and sends them a pm letting them know of thier muted status.
Council is notified of muted user.

name: unmute
description: Removes @MUTED role from target user and sends them a pm letting them know.
Council is notified of unmuted user.

name: lock
description: Locks the current channel from having messages sent in it.
Minions are exempt from the locking.
Council is notified of locked channel.

name: unlock
description: Unlocks the current channel
Council is notified of unlocked channel.

name: here
description: Displays all users with permissions to view the current channel.

Results can be filter by looking for users whose username or nickname on the server contains the substring indicated with any of the included strings or all users if no args are given. Multiple may be entered.

name: sfu
description: Returns the calendar description from current semester of <arg>

name: outline
description: Returns outline details of course `<arg0>`.
Defaults to current term and section d100.
Optionally, you may specify term in `<arg1>` and/or section with `<arg2>`.
Added keyword `next` will look at next semesters oultine for `<arg0>`;Note `next` will return error if it is not registration time.
